definition: structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
flushed with success/proud of one's success (in exams, promotion etc)/as pleased as punch
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
variant of 得意洋洋[de2 yi4 yang2 yang2]

sentences.english: IN 1887 physicists were feeling pretty smug about their subject.
sentences.chinese: 1887年物理學家們對自己的學科都頗爲自鳴得意。

sentences.english: The mountain range has much high peaks and deep canyons. The scenery is very lovely.
sentences.chinese: 這條山脈有很多岑嶺和幽谷，得意美極了。

sentences.english: That fellow exulted over a defeated rival.
sentences.chinese: 那傢伙因擊敗對手而得意洋洋。

sentences.english: People always want to live in its days of brilliance, but it is not possible.
sentences.chinese: 人們總是希望過着春風得意的日子，但這是不可能的。

sentences.english: He felt carried away as long as hearing some flattering words.
sentences.chinese: 他只要聽到幾句恭維話就會得意忘形。

sentences.english: We were carried away when we won the game.
sentences.chinese: 當我們贏得了比賽，我們高興的得意忘形。

sentences.english: At a time when mountain too proud, uncle Mao Qingyuan the late news.
sentences.chinese: 就在高山春風得意之時，大伯毛清源過世的消息傳來。

sentences.english: Anne Zhe satisfiedly says that don't see alternatively not as well who seek.
sentences.chinese: 安哲得意的說，也不看不看誰找的。

sentences.english: Grandpa threw back his head and laughed. Amusement danced in his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 爺爺仰着頭大笑起來，眼神裏滿是得意之情。

sentences.english: Indeed as expected emperor two male sons are more satisfied, know this kind of matter, emperor.
sentences.chinese: 果然帝二夫子更得意了，知道這種事，帝。

sentences.english: Did it again tonight too, " Blindy said happily."
sentences.chinese: “今晚俺又摸了一次，”盲漢得意地說。

sentences.english: Thus the fool, as compared with the scoundrel, is invariably self-complacent.
sentences.chinese: 所以同惡棍相比，蠢人總是自鳴得意。

sentences.english: Not to be too self-congratulatory, but you're absolutely right.
sentences.chinese: 不能太得意，不過你說的太對了。

sentences.english: Here we are in danger of smugly supposing superiority.
sentences.chinese: 自我感覺優越並自鳴得意，這樣的假設是很危險的。

sentences.english: He dwelt at length on one of his favorite subjects.
sentences.chinese: 他細述了他最得意的一個問題。

definition: joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
